    a 01) Preface to the dayoff package

    Nathan Brouwer

    2019-10-09

    a01-preface_to_dayhoff.Rmd

    The “dayoff” package is a teaching-oriented package based off of Dr. Avril Coghlan’s A little book of R for bioinformatics.. Almost all of text and code was originally written by Dr. Coghlan and distributed under the Creative Commons 3.0 license.

    The name of the package

    The package is named in honor of pioneering biochemist and bioinformatician Margaret Dayoff.

    Changes made to original source

    To meet the needs of my course I have

    1. Edited the original HTML document into RMarkdown
    2. Use RStudio IDE instead of basic R IDE
    3. Split up into short lessons
    4. Place functions by Coghlan into an R package.
    5. Changed which functions or packages are used; for example, replacing some SeqinR functions with entrez functions.
    6. Added additional plots and changed some plotting functions
    7. Removed .jpg images; I hope to add these back
    8. Fixed typos, removed dead links, and additional links, truned links to hypertext
    9. Added a summary section at the beginning listing the functions, vocabulary, software, organism, accession numbers

    Contents

    • The name of the package
    • Changes made to original source

    Developed by Nathan Brouwer.
